subject: Attention!
body:
Attention!
We have finally deposited your compensation check valued $1.750.000USD
through Western Union money transfer department after our finally
meeting with UN Representative Kampala regarding your fund, All you
will do is to contact Western Union director Mr Richard Moore E-mail:(
wwwwesternunionpaymentoffice@aol.com
), He will give you direction on
how you will be receiving the funds daily.
Remember to send him your Full information to avoid wrong transfer such as
Receiver's Name:-
Address:-
Country:-
Phone Number:-
Mr Richard Moore  has sent $5000 out today but western union can not
be able to send the payment with your email address alone, so contact
Mr Richard Moore or you call him +256-7024-65-225 as soon as you
receive this email and tell him to give you the MTCN to pick the
$5000, Please let us know as soon as you receive your fund.
Best Regards
Ambassador William W. Popp
U.S. Embassy in Kampala

subject: Re: Attention!
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your message. It's exciting to hear about the check deposit through Western Union. I'm a bit confused though, could you please clarify a few things for me?

Firstly, who is Mr. Richard Moore? And how is he involved in this process? 

Secondly, what does MTCN stand for and why do I need it to pick up the funds?

Lastly, could you explain more about the meeting with UN Kampala regarding my fund? How was it decided that my funds would be transferred this way?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Debra

subject: Mr Richard Moore Director Western Union Money Transfer
body:
WesternUnion® Money Transfer
Plot 28 30 Clive Rd, Next To Shell Petro Station Ji
Kampala, UgandaE-mail: wwwwesternunionpaymentoffice@aol.comTel:+256-7024-65-225 
Attention Customer 
My name is Mr Richard Moore, director of Western Union Office Uganda Kampala, We were instructed by United Nations Representatives in Kampala ,And Ambassador William W. Popp, U.S. Embassy in Kampala to transfer your compensation funds value the sum of US$1,750,000.00 to you through  Western Union transfer and you will be receiving $5000 USD  X 2 per day until you received all your total payment which is the sum of US$1,750,000.00 as scheduled in our office here, This type of transaction means you will be receiving $10.000 every day through  Western Union until the total of  US$1,750,000.00 is completely transferred to you
Note: We have transferred your first payment $5000 USD, You can track the MTCN  061-880-2943 with our website. MTCN: 0618802943
Sender: Richard Moore
We transferred your first payment $5000 but it was stopped by IMF due to lack of International Transfer Permit,  IMF said you can not pick up your first transfer without securing the International Transfer Permit in your name as instructed by IMF, The $5000 is available but you can not pick it up until you secure the certificate , We give you 100% assurance  that once you send the charges $155 and secure the International Transfer Permit in your name that you will pickup your first payment within 1 hour 30 minutes without problem and other payments will be transferring to you on daily bases without anymore problem.
We have tried our best to Indicate that this $155 should be deducted from your total prize but we found out that the funds have already been sealed intact and stamped by the IMF and cannot be accessed by anyone until you secure the International Transfer  Permit in your name  
So quickly reply immediately to give you the account officer receiver name to transfer the International Transfer Permit charges   
Thanks for your Prompt Response.
 
Yours in Service
Mr Richard MooreDirector Western Union Money Transfer

subject: Re: Mr Richard Moore Director Western Union Money Transfer
body:
Hello Mr. Richard Moore,

Thank you for your email and the detailed information about the transfer process. It's really interesting to know that such a large sum of money is being transferred through Western Union.

I'm curious, though, why was the IMF involved in this process? I thought Western Union transfers were usually straightforward. Also, could you please explain more about this Transfer Permit? I've never heard of it before.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Debra

subject: Re: FROM,,,,,,,,,Mr Richard Moore Director Western Union Money Transfer
body:

Thank you for your email and the detailed information about the transfer process. I appreciate your efforts in trying to make this transaction as smooth as possible.

I'm a bit confused about the Transfer Permit though. Could you please explain more about what it is and why it's necessary? Also, how much would it cost to secure this permit?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Debra

Attention Customer

But if you prefer to received the funds through bank to bank wire transfer we can also assisted you to push out the funds to any bank here in this country which they will help you transfer the funds view bank to bank wire transfer,because the reason why trying to send the money view western union is that it will be easy for you to be receiving  the money every day.

subject: Re: FROM,,,,,,,,,Mr Richard Moore Director Western Union Money Transfer
body:
Hello Mr. Richard,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the effort you're putting into helping me understand this process better. 

I'm curious about the Transfer Permit from the IMF office that you mentioned. Could you please explain a bit more about what it is and why it's necessary? Also, could you provide some more information on how the daily transfers through Western Union would work?

Best wishes,

subject: Re: Mr Richard Moore Director Western Union Money Transfer
body:
Hello Mr. Richard,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the effort you've put into explaining the process to me. I'm a bit confused about some parts though, could you please clarify?

You mentioned something about a Transfer Permit from the IMF office. Could you explain what this is and why it's necessary? Also, how does this permit affect the transfer process?

Regarding the bank to bank wire transfer option, could you provide more details? How would this work exactly and what are the benefits compared to receiving money through Western Union?

Lastly, you mentioned some charges for the Transfer Permit. Could you break down these costs for me? I'd like to understand what I'm paying for.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Debra
